intro: Struthanthus ligustrifolius, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive three-lobed shape. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, producing small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with feathery appendages. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions and limited water availability.
